item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 21, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Everyone is capable of, and can benefit from, mathematical thinking (149 points | 65 comments)
2. Niantic announces “Large Geospatial Model” trained on Pokémon Go player data (380 points | 294 comments)
3. The Matrix: Infinite-Horizon World Generation with Real-Time Interaction (69 points | 20 comments)
4. Hyrum's Law in Golang (50 points | 40 comments)
5. Show HN: We open-sourced our compost monitoring tech (86 points | 18 comments)
6. Electrobun: Cross-platform desktop applications written in TypeScript (129 points | 39 comments)
7. The Fastest Redis Ever (50 points | 19 comments)
8. Building Databases over a Weekend (80 points | 10 comments)
9. Undergraduates with family income below $200k will be tuition-free at MIT (576 points | 369 comments)
10. Z-Library Helps Students to Overcome Academic Poverty, Study Finds (322 points | 75 comments)
11. Doxx/Darkflare: DarkFlare TCPoCDN (TCP over CDN) (80 points | 16 comments)
12. AlphaQubit: AI to identify errors in Quantum Computers (113 points | 44 comments)
13. Weight-loss drug found to shrink muscle in mice, human cells (234 points | 249 comments)
14. January 1928: Dirac equation unifies quantum mechanics and special relativity (27 points | 16 comments)
15. Boeing overcharged the U.S. Air Force 8,000% above market for soap dispensers (99 points | 72 comments)
16. Show HN: Convolution Solver and Visualizer (8 points | discuss)
17. What is the origin of the lake tank image that has become a meme? (2021) (540 points | 125 comments)
18. How good are American roads? (192 points | 405 comments)
19. New Calculation Finds we are close to the Kessler Syndrome [video] (85 points | 93 comments)
20. /usr/bin/env -S uv run (62 points | 11 comments)
21. Vapi (YC W21) Is Hiring Founding Senior Engineer (Front End) ( | hide)
22. Pipe Viewer – A Unix Utility You Should Know About (171 points | 29 comments)
23. Does the Internet Route Around Damage? – Baltic Sea Cable Cuts (77 points | 17 comments)
24. Removing global state from LLD, the LLVM linker (8 points | discuss)
25. Bit-twiddling optimizations in Zed's Rope (116 points | 40 comments)
26. Shadow Boxing (2016) (32 points | 1 comment)
27. DOJ filed paperwork to US District Court to force Google to spin off Chrome [pdf] (102 points | 77 comments)
28. Between the Booms: AI in Winter – Communications of the ACM (68 points | 47 comments)
29. SQL, Homomorphisms and Constraint Satisfaction Problems (128 points | 13 comments)
30. Why one would use Qubes OS? (2023) (12 points | 4 comments)
